title: Report: Jason Varitek to remain on Red Sox’ coaching staff with new multi-year contract
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox Varitek's previous deal had expired when Boston's season ended earlier in October.
Jason Varitek has held various roles within the Red Sox front office and coaching staff since retiring from playing after the 2011 season.
Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff A beloved former Red Sox player will return to the team’s coaching staff with a new multi-year contract.

title: This Sam Adams beer is so strong that it’s illegal in 15 states
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News This year's edition of Utopias is brewed at a 30% ABV, which is considered a "milestone" for this potent brew.
Sam Adams brewed a 30% ABV beer, and it's illegal to buy in some states.
Courtesy of Sam Adams Sam Adams just made a beer so strong, you may not even be able to legally drink it in some states.

title: Jaylen Brown wants NBA to give players more support amid gambling scandal, reacts to Terry Rozier arrest
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics "I'm not sure what the answer is, but definitely something that people have to spend more time having conversations about.
" Jaylen Brown was teammates with Terry Rozier for three seasons.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Roche October 24, 2025 | 4:43 PM 3 minutes to read Jaylen Brown admitted that he isn’t fully up to date on the details in the illegal gambling scandal that led to the arrests of three NBA figures, but he isn’t a fan of the betting culture that’s made its way into sports.

title: Mike Vrabel calls out Rhamondre Stevenson for how he ran into end zone on touchdown run vs. Titans
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "We can’t sit there and be careless with the football.
" Rhamondre Stevenson ran for a four-yard touchdown in the Patriots' win over the Titans in Week 7, but Mike Vrabel didn't like how he ran into the end zone.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Conor Roche October 24, 2025 | 3:48 PM 2 minutes to read Mike Vrabel stuck by Rhamondre Stevenson’s side through the running back’s fumble issues early in the 2025 season.
